_description: Motorcycle Insurance Sample Data - Use this template for creating motorcycle insurance pages

data.intro_content: California motorcycle insurance averages $800/year. Lane splitting is legal, but riders face higher accident risks.
data.requirements_content: California requires minimum liability coverage of 15/30/5. Helmets are mandatory for all riders.

cost_factors.description: Sport bikes cost more to insure than cruisers
Legal in CA but increases accident risk

coverage_options.name: Liability
coverage_options.description: Covers damage you cause to others

faqs.question: Is motorcycle insurance required in California?
faqs.answer: Yes, minimum liability coverage is mandatory. You must show proof of insurance to register your bike.

faqs.question: Does California require helmets?
faqs.answer: Yes, all motorcycle riders and passengers must wear DOT-approved helmets.
